name: Global.Intl.NumberFormat
summary: Immutable object used to convert numbers to localized numeric strings.

methods.name: format
methods.summary: Formats the given number to a localized numeric string.

methods.name: formatToParts
methods.summary: Formats given number to an array of components describing what the formmated string would produce.
methods.description:
Returns an array of objects providing the "type" and "value" of each component the formatted string would produce. Can be used to fetch localized separator chracters, currency characters, currency symbol positions, etc.

For more detail, see the MDN website about formatToParts.

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary: The number to be formatted into parts.

returns.summary: Array of objects providing the "type" and "value" of each component in formatted string.

methods.name: resolvedOptions
methods.description:
Returns the formatting options the format object uses.

For more detail, see the MDN website about resolvedOptions.

methods.name: supportedLocalesOf
methods.summary: Static method indicating what locales are supported by NumberFormat from the given locale(s).
methods.description: For more detail, see the MDN website about supportedLocalesOf.

parameters.name: locales
parameters.summary: A string or array of strings providing BCP 47 locale identifiers to query.

returns.summary: Array containing a subset of the given locale strings supported by NumberFormat objects.

properties.name: constructor
properties.summary: Creates a new Intl.NumberFormat object with the given locale and formatting options.
properties.description:
# Syntax

new Intl.NumberFormat([locales[, options]])

# Parameters

  • locales: Global.String/Global.String[] (optional)

    The BCP 47 language and country code(s) to use for localized formatting. Can provide multiple locales where the best-supported locale will be favored in the order provided by the array. If parameter is not assigned, then the system may use the 'en-US' locale by default instead of the system's current locale. It's recommended to set this parameter using currentLocale.

  • options: NumberFormatOptions (optional)

    Provides settings indicating how a number should be formatted to a string.
